title: Cross-Price Elasticity for Goods X and Y

content.question: The cross-price elasticity of demand for Goods X and Y is <math alttext="negative 2.8" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>âˆ’</mo><mn>2.8</mn></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Based on this information, what is true about Good X and Good Y?

choices.label: Good X is a normal good and Good Y is an inferior good.
The goods have upward-sloping demand curves.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
